content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can use the `lowercase`, `strip` and `replace` functions from Base. Here is a function that accomplishes this:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function converts all the characters of string to lower case, strips any leading or trailing white spaces and replaces space and hyphens with underscores.
